Package ausroulette.model.bet

Class SplitBetImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • ausroulette.model.bet.SplitBetImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Bet, SplitBet
    public class SplitBetImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements SplitBet
    A concrete representation of a split bet in the Aussie Roulette game in the Further Programming Assignment.

    This implements the interface SplitBet and is used to represent both BetType.SPLIT_2 and BetType.SPLIT_4 bets.

    Note: When a split bet is created the implementation should arrange the numbers in using natural order (lower numbers before higher ones) so expected results can be returned from the split bet methods.

    Author:
    YOU!
    See Also:
    NumberBet, Bet, BetType, Pocket

    • Constructor Detail

      • SplitBetImpl

        public SplitBetImpl​(Player player,
                    int amount,
                    int[] numbers)
        One of three constructors this class must supply which can be used to create a BetType.SPLIT_2 or BetType.SPLIT_4 bet.
        Parameters:
        player - the player for whom the bet shall be placed
        amount - the amount bet
        numbers - the Pocket numbers on which to place the bet. This array will include either 2 or 4 number values which will determine the split type
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if supplied player or numbers is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in either of the following cases
        • supplied amount is not a positive number
        • supplied numbers array does not contain 2 or 4 values
        • supplied numbers array contains invalid pocket number values
        • supplied numbers array does not contain values that can be used to create a valid 2-way or 4-way split bet
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if supplied player does not have enough points to service the bet

      • SplitBetImpl

        public SplitBetImpl​(Player player,
                    int amount,
                    int number1,
                    int number2)
        One of three constructors this class must supply which can be used to create a BetType.SPLIT_2 bet.
        Parameters:
        player - the player for whom the bet shall be placed
        amount - the amount bet
        number1 - the first (or base) number for the split bet
        number2 - the second (or last) number for the split bet
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if supplied player is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in either of the following cases
        • supplied amount is not a positive number
        • supplied numbers are not valid pocket numbers
        • supplied numbers cannot be used to create a valid 2-way split bet
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if supplied player does not have enough points to service the bet

      • SplitBetImpl

        public SplitBetImpl​(Player player,
                    int amount,
                    int number1,
                    int number2,
                    int number3,
                    int number4)
        One of three constructors this class must supply which can be used to create a BetType.SPLIT_4 bet.
        Parameters:
        player - the player for whom the bet shall be placed
        amount - the amount bet
        number1 - the first (or base) number for the split bet
        number2 - the second number for the split bet
        number3 - the third number for the split bet
        number4 - the forth (or last) number for the split bet
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if supplied player is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in either of the following cases
        • supplied amount is not a positive number
        • supplied numbers are not valid pocket numbers
        • supplied numbers cannot be used to create a valid 2-way split bet
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if supplied player does not have enough points to service the bet

      • finaliseBet

        public int finaliseBet​(Pocket winningPocket)
        Description copied from interface: Bet
        Called when finalising a bet.

        This methods should be used change the state of a bet from being placed (outcome unknown) to being either a win or loss. This state should be able to be retrieved after the bet has been finalised (which would usually occur at the end of a spin).

        Specified by:
        finaliseBet in interface Bet
        Parameters:
        winningPocket - the winning (final) wheel pocket at the conclusion of a spin
        Returns:
        the amount won by the bet, or zero if result was a loss.
        See Also:
        Player.acceptBet(Bet), Player.applyBetOutcome(Bet), GameEngine.applyWinLoss(int, Pocket)

        public int getAmountWon()
        Description copied from interface: Bet

        Specified by:
        getAmountWon in interface Bet
        Returns:
        the amount won or 0 if a bet was a loss or is not yet finalised

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Generates a String representation of the SplitBet as seen in the supplied .log file.

        The String must match exactly the expected String. This will be tested during marking.

        Examples: 

         P1 bet 3 on 2-way Split [1, 2]
 P1 bet 3 on 2-way Split [1, 4]
 P1 bet 11 on 2-way Split [28, 29]
 P1 bet 4 on 4-way Split [28, 29, 31, 32]
 P2 bet 10 on 4-way Split [31, 32, 34, 35]
        Specified by:
        toString in interface Bet
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String representing the SplitBet
